document.heading: Youth Residential Facilities Licensure Act of 1986

history.narrative: Law 6-139, the “Youth Residential Facilities Licensure Act of 1986,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-224, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 27, 1986, and June 10, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 13, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-177 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
